intro: Eleocharis quaesita, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small, grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, cylindrical stems and small, clustered spikes of flowers. This species typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded soils, such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Eleocharis quaesita is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to tolerate waterlogged conditions. Its simple morphology and ecological niche make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
